_header: God was I-born in Bedlam / I-born he was to Jerusalem
_description: A charm against wolves and thieves (perhaps originally addressed to Woden) — in rough couplets

BNnalat693.First Lines:
God was iborin in bedlemIborin he was to
                    ierusalem…
BNnalat693.Last Lines:
…palle pwey pstilplle ptilple phichphabpbe pydon
                    pmipwilple
BNnalat693.Note:
Olim Ashburnham 120; the cipher explained by Smallwood (1989)
